openBetaDisclaimerTitle: THIS IS OPEN BETA OF SimPro Manager 2
openBetaDisclaimerContent: PLEASE BE AWARE THAT THIS IS AN OPEN BETA TEST OF SimPro Manager 2.0. YOU MAY ENCOUNTER BUGS OR EVEN CRASHES, THIS WILL NOT DAMAGE YOUR DEVICES OR COMPUTER. PRESET FILE FORMATS MAY NOT BE COMPATIBLE WITH THE STABLE VERSION OF SimPro Manager 2.0.

base.forceFirmwareUpdateText: SimPro2 require newer base firmware to work

tooltip.totalForce: This is the percentage of the force feedback output strength from the game. It is recommended for beginners to use a value around 70%, while professional players should set this value to the maximum and adjust the force feedback settings individually within the game. (Some games may require enabling reverse force feedback by default, such as rF2.)
tooltip.smoothLevel: Controls the smoothness of the force feedback signal (0 = OFF). Lower values provide more detail at the cost of increased noise and FFB spikes. Higher values provide a smoother experience, with less noise, at the cost of reduced detail.
tooltip.wheelReturnSpeed: Controls how fast the steering wheel can rotate and react to ffb changes. 100% allows for maximum rotation speed, but can make the wheel unstable. Lower values produce a more stable wheel at the cost of responsiveness. This setting isn`t affected by other parameters.
tooltip.vehicleSuspension: Enhances force feedback from the road surface & vehicle suspension (0 = OFF). Higher values give more information, but may increase noise and heat while driving.

tooltip.angle: Set the maximum steering wheel rotation angle. Recommendations：Karting 90 degrees, Formula 270-360 degrees, Rally cars 460-540 degrees, Touring cars 720-900 degrees, Passenger cars 900-1080 degrees, Modern trucks 900-1080 degrees.
tooltip.hardLockAngle: Manually set the angle at which the Soft Lock takes effect without,affecting steering Linearity.
tooltip.limitStrength: The higher the number, the heavier the feel when reaching the end stop and the more resistance you will experience. The rebound at the end stop will also be greater. It is recommended to use "Soft" and "Normal" settings.

tooltip.gameInertia: These are Active Effects produced by the game(Default = 100 %)
tooltip.gameSpring: These are Active Effects produced by the game(Default = 100 %)
tooltip.gameDamper: These are Active Effects produced by the game(Default = 100 %)
tooltip.gameFriction: These are Active Effects produced by the game(Default = 100 %)

tooltip.mechanicalSpring: Adds a constant spring force used to center the wheel (0 = OFF). Higher values increase the strength of this effect. It is NOT recommended to use this setting when using a direct drive wheelbase.
tooltip.mechanicalDamper: Adjusts the amount of damping applied to the wheel as it rotates (0 = OFF). This is a constant effect that adds a smooth resistance to the wheel, which can help dampen sharp FFB effects and give the wheel a richer feel.
tooltip.mechanicalFriction: Adjusts the amount of Friction applied to the wheel as it rotates (0 = OFF). This is a constant effect used to add weight and improve wheel stability. Higher values produce stronger resistance, making the wheel harder to steer.
tooltip.mechanicalInertia: Adjust the amount of inertia applied to the steering shaft (0 = OFF). Higher values ​​simulate a heavier wheel, giving it more momentum and allowing it to spin longer when released.
tooltip.torqueLimit: Sets the maximum torque threshold of the base (100% = OFF). All force feedback details below the set threshold is preserved, anything above the set threshold will be clipped. Limiting maximum torque on a high torque wheelbase will allow you to retain proper force feedback while protecting you from sudden high torque crashes or FFB spikes.
tooltip.centralDamper: As the vehicle speed increases, the steering wheel becomes heavier and more stable near the center (Telemetry support required), which reduces oscillations when driving at speed. Higher values increase the strength of this effect (0 = OFF).
tooltip.interpolationLevel: The SIMAGIC Zero Latency FFB Upsampling Algorithm converts low frequency force feedback signals into high quality signals, producing smoother and more detailed force feedback compared to lower frequencies. Higher values increase the strength of this effect, (0 = OFF).
tooltip.confilter_coe: The Dynamic Prediction Level is designed to predict the next state of the vehicle and force feedback in the game based on data from previous moments (such as vehicle speed, steering angle, road surface feedback, etc,). By pre-calculating and simulating to optimizes the response of force feedback("Note: Value too high may causing noise or high frequency vibration")
tooltip.frequency: 0 indicates off, functioning to filter out high-frequency noise and smooth the signal. The larger the value, the smoother it becomes, but excessive smoothing may lose some details while making it quieter. Proper smoothing can reduce abrupt force feedback output.
tooltip.slowrate: Slew Rate Control is used to adjust the dynamic response speed of the force feedback signal in the system. By controlling the rate of signal changes, it optimizes the smoothness and real-time performance of force feedback.Higher settings gives smoother FFB, for balancing too strong and sharp kerbs or bumps effects but won't affect grip and details on hand (0=no limits)
tooltip.staticforce_reduce: Reduce constant cornering force but won't affect handling or road details

pedals.forceFirmwareUpdateText: SimPro2 require newer pedal firmware to work

tooltip.upper: Convex = Initial travel has Increased sensitivity that Decreases as the axis is engaged.
tooltip.lower: Concave = Initial travel has Decreased sensitivity that Increases as the axis is engaged.
tooltip.s: S - Curve = Initial and Final stages of the travel are Less sensitive.
tooltip.tireSlipSensitivity: The higher the value, the easier it is to trigger slip vibrations. The lower the value, the less likely slip vibrations will be triggered.

games.title: Games

info.rbr: To enable RBR Telemetry, please confirm your Telemetry Port in RSF Launcher is 6776.
info.lfs:
To enable LFS Telemetry, please confirm these config in your LFS cfg.txt(can be find in LFS installation folder) in as following:
OutGauge Mode 1
OutGauge Delay 1
OutGauge IP 127.0.0.1
OutGauge Port 10888
OutGauge ID 0
info.iracing:
iRacing DOES NOT officially export following telemetry properties at this moment:
1.Traction Control active status
2.Running tyre pressure
3.Running tyre tempreature
info.f1:
If telemetry still not active after Telemetry Patch, Please check following settings in Game/Options/Telemetry Settings :
1.UDP Telemetry = ON
2.UDP Broadcast = OFF
3.UDP Address = 127.0.0.1
4.UDP Port = 10888

games.theFollowingTestedGameSettingsAreRecomme: The following tested game settings are recommended for a better driving experience(Double-click to zoom in on the guide image)

telemetry.speedHint: When the corresponding value is reached, the light will turn on.
telemetry.brakeHint: Brake travel follows based on the selected light color and position
telemetry.rpmSettingTip: You can change the RPM value through Manual Input, Dragging the Slider, or Mouse Scroll Wheel.

tooltip.STATIC_EFFECT: Default static lighting effect of the device
tooltip.PIT_LIMITER: Trigger light effect when pit limiter is activated
tooltip.IS_IN_PIT: Trigger light effect when the vehicle enters the pit lane area
tooltip.ABS_ACTIVE: Trigger light effect when ABS is enabled
tooltip.ABS triggered: Triggers light effects when ABS activates during braking
tooltip.TC_ACTIVE: TC intervenes during vehicle acceleration, triggering the lighting effect
tooltip.DRS_ON: Lighting effect triggered when DRS is activated
tooltip.LEFT_INDICATOR: Lighting effect triggered when the left turn signal is activated
tooltip.RIGHT_INDICATOR: Lighting effect triggered when the right turn signal is activated
tooltip.LEFT_CAR_SPOTTER: Lighting effect triggered when a vehicle is detected on the left side
tooltip.RIGHT_CAR_SPOTTER: Lighting effect triggered when a vehicle is detected on the right side
tooltip.ENGINE_IGNITION_ON: Lighting effect triggered upon engine ignition
tooltip.ENGINE_STARTED: Lighting effect triggered when engine startup is complete
tooltip.GEAR: Update light effect when gear changes
tooltip.RPM: Adjust light effects dynamically based on current RPM
tooltip.RPM_REDLINE: Engine RPM approaching or reaching the redline zone
tooltip.SPEED: Dynamically adjust lighting effects based on speed
tooltip.FUEL: Triggered when fuel drops below the preset value
tooltip.THROTTLE: Adjust lighting effects dynamically based on throttle position
tooltip.BRAKE: Adjust lighting effects dynamically based on brake pressure
tooltip.CLUTCH: Adjust lighting effects dynamically based on clutch position
tooltip.HAND_BRAKE: Trigger lighting effects when the handbrake is activated
